criteria: Application to Nutritious Food and Beverage Choices
descriptions: The student does not identify any steps of a decision-making process.
The student identifies one or two steps of a decision-making process but lacks clarity.
The student identifies some steps of a decision-making process with limited explanation.
The student accurately identifies most steps of a decision-making process with reasonable clarity.
The student clearly and accurately identifies the steps of a decision-making process.
The student comprehensively identifies the steps of a decision-making process and provides insightful explanations.
The student fails to connect the decision-making process to selecting nutritious foods and beverages.
The student vaguely attempts to connect the decision-making process to food and beverage choices but lacks specific examples.
The student provides limited examples of how the decision-making process applies to food and beverage choices.
The student demonstrates a good understanding of how the decision-making process can be used to make nutritious choices with some relevant examples.
The student clearly illustrates how the decision-making process supports the selection of nutritious foods and beverages with detailed examples.
The student expertly demonstrates the application of the decision-making process in selecting nutritious foods and beverages, providing comprehensive examples and considering various factors.
The student demonstrates no understanding of nutritional value.
The student shows minimal awareness of nutritional value.
The student presents a basic understanding of nutritional value but struggles to apply it.
The student exhibits a solid understanding of nutritional value and can apply it to food choices.
The student displays a strong understanding of nutritional value and provides insightful examples.
The student showcases an exceptional understanding of nutritional value and critically analyzes its role in food and beverage choices.
